servinfo.title: Front Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Front Wheel Hub Assembly and Steering Knuckle Components

item.ptxt: Never disassemble front wheel hub assembly. Disassembly will spoil its original function. If faulty condition is found, replace it with new one.
End face of one bolt among hub bolts is painted as a match mark at brake disc installation.
Be sure to paint end face of new bolt for painted bolt when replacing hub bolts with new one.

s1.ptxt: Depress foot brake pedal and hold it. Remove drive haft nut (1).

attention3.ptxt: Hang removed caliper with a wire hook or the like (3) so as to prevent brake hose (4) from bending, twisting or tension. Do not depress brake pedal during pads removal.
Do not operate brake pedal with pads removed.

s1.ptxt: Pull brake disc (2) off by using two 8 mm bolts.
Remove wheel hub housing bolts (3), and then remove wheel hub assembly (1) and dust cover (2).
Remove hub bolts (1) with copper hammer or hydraulic press after putting a mark by the side of painted bolt on wheel hub.

attention2.ptxt: Never remove bolt unless replacement is necessary.
Be sure to use a new bolt for replacement.

s1.ptxt: Insert new hub bolt (1) in hub hole. Rotate hub bolt slowly to assure that serrations are aligned with those made by original bolt.
Paint end face of one bolt beside mark on wheel hub putting at removal step 8).
Apply grease to end face of inner ring (2) before front wheel nub (1) installation.

attention2.ptxt: Do not apply the grease to the encoder section to avoid the encoder malfunction.

s1.ptxt: Install wheel hub (1) and dust cover (2) to steering knuckle.
Tighten wheel hub housing bolts (3) to specified torque
Install brake disc referring to Front Brake Disc Removal and Installation and brake caliper.
Tighten caliper carrier bolt to specified torque.
Depress foot brake pedal and hold it there. Tighten new drive shaft nut (1) to specified torque.
Caulk drive shaft nut (1) as shown.
Tightening wheel nuts to specified torque.
